values.value: (There was a dog and a monkey), and they say how they went to buy some salt.
yē wà yē sá̰ ékɛ́ wò ló wɛ̀ lū
yē wà yē sá̰ ékɔ̀ ló wɛ̀ lū
When they went to buy salt,
fḭ́ wà ló wɛ́ lú kɛ̄ wɔ̀
fḭ́ wà ló wɛ́ lú kɛ̄ ɔ̀
Yē wā nú sórō gbɔ̀ kɛ̀
Yē wā nú sórō gbɔ̀ kɛ̀
yē gbɛ́ fḭ̄ yí lɛ́ à pà nà kɛ̀
yē gbɛ́ fḭ̄ yí lɛ́ à pà nà kɛ̀
The dog said that, it said that in the place, in that place where (because) the water came up, it can swim across that place.
yē jēŋ̄ sá̰ à yè sá̰ à yè sá̰ gbɛ̄fḭ́ yí lɛ́ à pà nà gbɔ̀ kɛ̀ sá̰ ŋ́ mānā ŋ́ sí à dōŋ̄ ŋ̄ cḭ̄
à yè sá̰ ~ à yè sá̰ - reduptication with the semantics of insistance
yē jēŋ̄ sá̰ à yè sá̰ à yè sá̰ gbɛ̄fḭ́ yí lɛ́ à pà nà gbɔ̀ kɛ̀ sá̰ ŋ́ mānā ŋ́ sí à dōŋ̄ ŋ̄ cḭ̄
Then the monkey also said: "I can cross (the river) from above
yē zɔ̄tí tɛ̄ɛ̄ à yè sá̰ ŋ́ tɛ̄ɛ̄ ŋ́ sí gɔ̀ núŋ́ yē ŋ̄ pálá
yē zɔ̄tí tɛ̄ɛ̄ à yè sá̰ ŋ́ tɛ̄ɛ̄ ŋ́ sí gɔ̀ núŋ́ yē ŋ̄ pálá
and come down (on the other bank). This is how my salt will not get wet."
à kɛ́lɛ̄bí yē. Ŋ́ wɛ́ lɛ̄ à yɔ̄ŋ̄ ɔ̀.
yē - probably is a target marker
à kɛ́lɛ̄bí yē ŋ́ wɛ́ là yɔ̄ŋ̄ ɔ̀
The dog enters water, swims and crosses the river.
yē jéŋ́ ā sɔ̄ yí ló fḭ̄ à yí lɛ́ dòŋ̀ fḭ̄ à yí lɛ́ cḭ̄ kɛ̀
yē jéŋ́ ā sɔ̄ yí ló fḭ̄ à yí lɛ́ dòŋ̀ fḭ̄ à yí lɛ́ cḭ̄ kɛ̀
yē zɔ̄tí tɛ́ɛ́ ā gɔ̄ núŋ́ bí lɛ̀
yē zɔ̄tí tɛ́ɛ́ ā gɔ̄ núŋ́ bí lɛ̀
and came down (on the other side).
And when it crossed the river and came down,
fḭ́ à gɔ́ núŋ́ bī fḭ̄ à pālā kɛ̀ wɔ̄
fḭ́ à gɔ́ núŋ́ bī fḭ̄ à pālā kɛ̀ wɔ̄
ékɛ́ à wɛ̀ à yɔ̄ŋ̄ nà
so he will pull away (take) the monkey’s salt.
è bé zɔ̄tí lɛ̄ mɔ̄ nɛ̰̀ sīā wɛ́lɛ́
è bé zɔ̄tí lɛ̄ mɔ̄ nɛ̰̀ sīā wɛ́lɛ́
And the monkey said that he does not agree (and will not give the salt).
yé  zɔ̄tí lɛ́ tɛ́ɛ́ à yè sé ē bá yú ā wò ɔ̀
yé  zɔ̄tí lɛ́ tɛ́ɛ́ à yè sé ē bá yú ā wò ɔ̀
gbɛ́fḭ́ wà gbùɛ̄dà lɛ́ pɔ̄sí kɛ̀ wò kɛ̀
gbɛ́fḭ́ wà gbùɛ̄dà lɛ́ pɔ̄sí kɛ̄ wò kɛ̀
Talked again and again, and became silent.
yē à yē à yē pɔ̀ɔ̀ kɛ̀ yē à lɛ́ tā lɛ̀
yā yē à yē pɔ̀ɔ̀ kɛ̀ yē à lɛ́ tā lɛ̀
And the dog said that as they are arguing so much about this
fíŋ́ à yē sá̰ ékɛ́ à yè nā pɔ̀ɔ̀
fíŋ́ à yē sá̰ ékɛ́ à yè nā pɔ̀ɔ̀
On Thursday they should discuss is together (with other monkeys and dogs).
úwúè lɛ̀ kɛ̀ èkɛ́ bā túá bā céŋ́ yè nɔ̄
úwúè lɛ̀ kɛ̀ èkɛ́ bā túá bā céŋ́ yè nɔ̄
yē úwúè lɛ́ à sòró kɛ̀ wɔ̀
yē úwúè là sòró kɛ̀ ɔ̀
And the monkey (with other monkeys) came to their prepared place
yē zɔ̄tí à ló à mɔ̄ gbɛ́ sūsū lɛ̀
yē zɔ̄tí à ló à mɔ̄ gbɛ́ sūsū lɛ̀
The dog also came to the prepared place.
yē ... wā yē sá̰ wā sī kā̰ ... jéŋ́ à tɛ́ɛ́ à ló àmɔ̄ gbɛ̀ sūsū lɛ̀
yē ... wā yē sá̰ wā sī kā̰ ... jéŋ́ à tɛ́ɛ́ à ló àmɔ̄ gbɛ̀ sūsū lɛ̀
And he (dog) came to that place.
And it said: “Dogs, dogs, dogs, you all who came here!
yē à yē sá̰ jéŋ́ wō jéŋ́ wō jéŋ́ wō sá̰ ká sēē pítú kā nū
yē à yē sá̰ jéŋ́ wō jéŋ́ wō jéŋ́ wō sá̰ ká sēē pítú kā nū
Dogs, who are here with me!"
yē jéŋ́ nú wò mìnì à bɛ̀ŋ̀ gbɔ̀ lɛ̀
mìnì à bɛ̀ŋ̀ - unite the heads together
yē jéŋ́ nú wò mìnì à bɛ̀ŋ̀ gbɔ̀ lɛ̀
The monkey also came and haunched.
yē zɔ̄tí lɛ̄ tɛ̄ɛ̄ à ló zūmālà
yē zɔ̄tí lɛ̄ tɛ̄ɛ̄ à ló zūmālà
"Monkeys, monkeys, monkeys, you all who came here!"
zɔ̄tí wō zɔ̄tí wō zɔ̄tí wō kà sēē pítú kà nū
Можно ли zoti nu wo ? Нельзя, pitu - все.
zɔ̄tí wō zɔ̄tí wō zɔ̄tí wō kà sēē pítú kà nū
So they all got together in one place
yē wà nū bɛ̀ŋ̀ gbɔ̄ lɛ̀
yē wà nū bɛ̀ŋ̀ gbɔ̄ lɛ̀
And everyone started asking them (the dog and the monkey).
And when they were asking them,
fḭ́ wā wò làà kɛ̀ wɔ̀
fḭ́ wā wò làà kɛ̀ ɔ̀
yē bóŋ́ nā wànà nū nɛ̄
yē bóŋ́ ná wànà nū nɛ̄
And when (because) the fight was going on
gbɛ̄ fḭ̄ bóŋ́ nā sí à wànà nū kɛ̄ wɔ̀
gbɛ̄ fḭ̄ bóŋ́ nā sí à wànà nū kɛ̄ ɔ̀
when everyone was already fighting with one another,
fīŋ̄ wò wò cēŋ̄ mɛ̀ kɛ̀
fīŋ̄ wò wò cēŋ̄ mɛ̀ kɛ̀
the dogs beat the monkeys with their hands.
trélé jēŋ̄ nù wò wɔ̀ŋ̀ à sá̰ zɔ̄tí nù zì
trélé jēŋ̄ nù wò wɔ̀ŋ̀ à sá̰ zɔ̄tí nù zì
And then the monkeys climbed high (on the trees)
trélé yē zɔ̄tí nù wà drɛ̀ŋ̀ núŋ́ nɛ̄
trélé yē zɔ̄tí nù wà drɛ̀ŋ̀ núŋ́ nɛ̄
So this is why they say that monkeys live high (on the trees and do not come down).
ékɛ́ gbɛ̀ à yè kɛ̀ fḭ̄ zɔ̄tí nù wà ló núŋ́ kɛ̀
ékɛ́ gbɛ̀ à yè kɛ̀ fḭ̄ zɔ̄tí nù wà ló núŋ́ kɛ́
píā lɛ̄ tɛ̄ɛ̄ bé lēē là
píā lɛ̄ tɛ̄ɛ̄ bé lēē là
à dɔ̄ gbɛ̄ mā yè kɛ̀
à dɔ̄ gbɛ̄ mā yè kɛ̀
